programme.title: Phoenix, Oregon
Phoenix, Oregon
programme.desc: Phoenix, Oregon: Directed by Gary Lundgren. With James Le Gros, Jesse Borrego, Lisa Edelstein, Diedrich Bader. Two longtime friends battle mid-life crisis by opening a bowling alley/pizzeria in their small hometown." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt8586088/","name":"Phoenix, Oregon","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMDlhMGRlYzctNWYzOC00NmE3LWE3MWQtNDk4NmNiODUwMTcyXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMzQxOTU3NjU@._V1_.jpg","description":"Two longtime friends battle mid-life crisis by opening a bowling alley/pizzeria in their small hometown.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt8586088/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"LilyWai"},"dateCreated":"2020-04-22","inLanguage":"English","name":"Genuine","reviewBody":"Loved this film, a little sweet snapshot of how droll the midlife grind can be when you don't have the life you thought you'd have. Great understated performance from James LeGros as Bobby, and the full cast of his friends & associates offer plenty of dramatic layers for his character to engage with. Jesse Borego as Carlos is a breath of fresh air to Bobby's downer moments & his passion for his craft is infectious. I appreciated the fumbled semi romantic thread between Bobby and Tanya too as too often in movies it's all packaged up so neatly the viewer is deprived of seeing the truth when it comes to 'just not the right time' connections. Oh and have to mention Kevin Corrigan's Al, nicely positioned in both character and storyline as Bobby's polar opposite nemesis. Highly recommend but one negative is I almost passed this by thanks to the insipid title. I get the 'Phoenix' connection in the storyline but come on, something a little more thoughtful would be cherry on the top.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":339,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.3},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Comedy"],"datePublished":"2020-03-20","keywords":"battle","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Trailer [EN]","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi3567762969","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjZkZmZlM2YtYzgwZi00YTBiLTg2MmUtYWFhYjFjOWI3ODgzXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjZkZmZlM2YtYzgwZi00YTBiLTg2MmUtYWFhYjFjOWI3ODgzXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","description":""},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001457/","name":"James Le Gros"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001963/","name":"Jesse Borrego"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0249046/","name":"Lisa Edelstein"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1390437/","name":"Gary Lundgren"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0324375/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1390437/","name":"Gary Lundgren"}],"duration":"PT1H48M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: We're No Angels
Mi nismo anđeli
programme.desc:
We're No Angels: Directed by Neil Jordan. With Robert De Niro, Sean Penn, Demi Moore, Hoyt Axton. Two escaped cons only prayer to escape is to pass themselves off as priests and pass by the police blockade at the border into the safety of Canada." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0098625/","name":"We're No Angels","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMWQ3YWQ5NjMtNTVlZi00ZTk2LWFjZDctYjNiNzVhYjllMjFiXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMzk1NzcyOTA@._V1_.jpg","description":"Two escaped cons only prayer to escape is to pass themselves off as priests and pass by the police blockade at the border into the safety of Canada.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0098625/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"PredragReviews"},"dateCreated":"2017-04-06","inLanguage":"English","name":"Could be better.","reviewBody":""We're No Angels" is a movie made for those faces, and one of the pleasures of watching the film is to see them looking sidelong at each other as they try to figure a way out of the complicated mess they're in. The movie has a lot of other good stuff to look at (including dramatic period locations in a small Canadian town) and to listen to (dialogue by David Mamet), but I can think of no other recent movie in which so much of the pleasure lies in watching the expressions on the faces of the actors - especially when they're reacting, not talking. Mamet and Neil Jordan, who directed the movie, wisely remember the most important thing about any mistaken- identity comedy: The fact that someone's identity is mistaken is not always funny even the first time and rarely thereafter. Movies that depend on mistaken identities for their laughs are among the slowest, dreariest slogs through cinema.

Too bad that the film came out to be both simplistic and ordinary despite of the talent involved especially when it features De Niro and Penn,two of the best actors in Hollywood; and Jordan,one of the finest director of the industry.There were a lot of boring moments.Also,it just turned out to be somewhat corny and provides minimal laughter in a lot of scenes.Overall,it was definitely a misfire from the cast and the director involved as it does not live up to its potential.

Overall rating: 6 out of 10.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":6}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":22742,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.1},"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Comedy","Crime"],"datePublished":"1989-12-15","keywords":"lingerie slip,superstition,pig,cross,contraction in title","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"We're No Angels","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1578483225","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYWJiY2VjMDgtYWU5OC00NDllLTlmOTctM2Y0MzQ2NmRiNmM5XkEyXkFqcGdeQVRoaXJkUGFydHlJbmdlc3Rpb25Xb3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYWJiY2VjMDgtYWU5OC00NDllLTlmOTctM2Y0MzQ2NmRiNmM5XkEyXkFqcGdeQVRoaXJkUGFydHlJbmdlc3Rpb25Xb3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Official Trailer"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000134/","name":"Robert De Niro"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000576/","name":"Sean Penn"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000193/","name":"Demi Moore"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001403/","name":"Neil Jordan"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0023400/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0023400/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000519/","name":"David Mamet"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0532030/","name":"Ranald MacDougall"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0404062/","name":"Albert Husson"}],"duration":"PT1H46M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: The Wild Bunch
Divlja banda
programme.desc: The Wild Bunch: Directed by Sam Peckinpah. With William Holden, Ernest Borgnine, Robert Ryan, Edmond O'Brien. An aging group of outlaws look for one last big score as the "traditional" American West is disappearing around them." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0065214/","name":"The Wild Bunch","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNGUyYTZmOWItMDJhMi00N2IxLWIyNDMtNjUxM2ZiYmU5YWU1XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNjc1NTYyMjg@._V1_.jpg","description":"An aging group of outlaws look for one last big score as the "traditional" American West is disappearing around them.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0065214/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"dexter-3"},"dateCreated":"1998-10-15","inLanguage":"English","name":"A great period western...","reviewBody":"Critics of Sam Peckinpah generally focus on the gore and violence in his films. "The Wild Bunch" will probably not assuage these critics, but the violence is not gratuitous. In fact, it is almost perfectly meshed in this story of a group of outlaws held together by some frail and some strong bonds who realize that their era - and probably their lives - are almost at an end. The story also deals with a man (Robert Ryan) who was wounded and forced out of the gang, and who must now capture and kill his friend (William Holden), with no option other than to succeed. This film is also about loyalty, choice and honor, and is carried by surprisingly strong acting and writing. Yes the violence is on a large scale (which seems to be commonplace for films portraying the Mexican Revolution), but it is completely in place with these characters and the era in which they live. This is not always a pleasant film to watch, but it is very rewarding, and may be the best film Peckinpah made.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":9}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":82145,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.9},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Action","Adventure","Western"],"datePublished":"1969-06-19","keywords":"arizona,yuma territorial prison,shoulder holster,arizona territory,yaqui indian","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"The Wild Bunch","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2817703705","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMGVhZDdlNDEtYjA4Yy00MTI4LWEwMTctZWE2ZDgyZjRmMDQ3XkEyXkFqcGdeQTNwaW5nZXN0._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMGVhZDdlNDEtYjA4Yy00MTI4LWEwMTctZWE2ZDgyZjRmMDQ3XkEyXkFqcGdeQTNwaW5nZXN0._V1_.jpg","description":"Official Trailer"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000034/","name":"William Holden"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000308/","name":"Ernest Borgnine"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0752813/","name":"Robert Ryan"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001603/","name":"Sam Peckinpah"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0076018/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0338396/","name":"Walon Green"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001603/","name":"Sam Peckinpah"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0796429/","name":"Roy N. IMDb data; ttnr: 0065214, Title: The Wild Bunch, --- Description: The Wild Bunch: Directed by Sam Peckinpah. With William Holden, Ernest Borgnine, Robert Ryan, Edmond O'Brien. An aging group of outlaws look for one last big score as the "traditional" American West is disappearing around them." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0065214/","name":"The Wild Bunch","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNGUyYTZmOWItMDJhMi00N2IxLWIyNDMtNjUxM2ZiYmU5YWU1XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNjc1NTYyMjg@._V1_.jpg","description":"An aging group of outlaws look for one last big score as the "traditional" American West is disappearing around them.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0065214/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"dexter-3","dateCreated":"1998-10-15","inLanguage":"English","name":"A great period western...","reviewBody":"Critics of Sam Peckinpah generally focus on the gore and violence in his films. "The Wild Bunch" will probably not assuage these critics, but the violence is not gratuitous. In fact, it is almost perfectly meshed in this story of a group of outlaws held together by some frail and some strong bonds who realize that their era - and probably their lives - are almost at an end. The story also deals with a man (Robert Ryan) who was wounded and forced out of the gang, and who must now capture and kill his friend (William Holden), with no option other than to succeed. This film is also about loyalty, choice and honor, and is carried by surprisingly strong acting and writing. Yes the violence is on a large scale (which seems to be commonplace for films portraying the Mexican Revolution), but it is completely in place with these characters and the era in which they live. This is not always a pleasant film to watch, but it is very rewarding, and may be the best film Peckinpah made.","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":9,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":82145,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.9,"contentRating":"R","genre":["Action","Adventure","Western"],"datePublished":"1969-06-19","keywords":"arizona,yuma territorial prison,shoulder holster,arizona territory,yaqui indian","trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"The Wild Bunch","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2817703705","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMGVhZDdlNDEtYjA4Yy00MTI4LWEwMTctZWE2ZDgyZjRmMDQ3XkEyXkFqcGdeQTNwaW5nZXN0._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMGVhZDdlNDEtYjA4Yy00MTI4LWEwMTctZWE2ZDgyZjRmMDQ3XkEyXkFqcGdeQTNwaW5nZXN0._V1_.jpg","description":"Official Trailer","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000034/","name":"William Holden","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000308/","name":"Ernest Borgnine","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0752813/","name":"Robert Ryan"],"director":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001603/","name":"Sam Peckinpah"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0076018/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0338396/","name":"Walon Green","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001603/","name":"Sam Peckinpah","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0796429/","name":"Roy N. programme.title: Spiral
Spirala
programme.desc:
Spiral: Directed by Kurtis David Harder. With Jeffrey Bowyer-Chapman, Ari Cohen, June Laporte, Ty Wood. A same-sex couple move to a small town to enjoy a better quality of life and raise their daughter with strong social values. But when neighbors throw a very strange party, nothing is as it seems in their picturesque neighborhood." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt9247314/","name":"Spiral","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMmU0Nzc0OGYtNzRlZS00NjIwLTkxOTktZWU4NWQ1ODhiYTk0XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNDgyNzAxMzY@._V1_.jpg","description":"A same-sex couple move to a small town to enjoy a better quality of life and raise their daughter with strong social values. But when neighbors throw a very strange party, nothing is as it seems in their picturesque neighborhood.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt9247314/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"FilmGuy81"},"dateCreated":"2020-09-17","inLanguage":"English","name":"Spiral into boredom","reviewBody":"The idea of a gay character-led horror film appealed to me hugely as a gay man and avid horror fan. Identity politics aside; viewing 'Spiral' objectively, it lacks the promise of its potential. I'm a little over indie slow-burn, symbolic-heavy horror movies at the moment as the new generation of filmmakers are pumping them out faster than a David Lynch traffic light changes colours.

The majority of the film concerns itself exploring the topic of 'paranoia versus reality' which is taxing after about 20 minutes much less an hour and 20 minutes of this single beat repeated again and again and again. Additionally, I didn't think the paranoia brought anything new or interesting to the table and certainly wasn't enough to make me care for the characters.

Jeffrey Bowyer-Chapman as the lead makes an effort to bring the level of intensity required to make his character work but unfortunately does not succeed. There are several plot holes within his character's backstory which results in the outcome of audience apathy for what he's going through.

Genre-wise this fails to achieve a horror tone. I can't honestly say there was a single moment when I felt horrified by any particular event. When the punchline finally arrived I stopped caring long before as the characters did not develop and the scenes didn't contain dialogue and conflict structured to sustain interest.

In the climax (no spoilers) the antagonist blatantly states the moral of the story, causing me to see weak writing rather than agreement for its existence. Sadly, I'm chucking this movie onto the pile of the hundreds of under-developed gay themed films that simply don't have the quality and/or budget to create a story of honesty, originality and significance.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":3}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":3878,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.5},"contentRating":"Not Rated","genre":["Drama","Horror","Mystery"],"datePublished":"2020-09-17","keywords":"same sex couple,cult,neighbor,small town,targeted by a cult","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Official Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1319944473","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BM2UxZDg3YWUtYzVhMi00MmVkLWI3M2EtYTJkNjdkNGNlYzNjXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BM2UxZDg3YWUtYzVhMi00MmVkLWI3M2EtYTJkNjdkNGNlYzNjXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"A same-sex couple move to a small town so they can enjoy a better quality of life and raise their 16 year-old daughter with the best social values. But nothing is as it seems in their picturesque neighborhood. And when Malik sees the folks next door throwing a very strange party, something shocking has got to give."},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2242337/","name":"Jeffrey Bowyer-Chapman"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0169218/","name":"Ari Cohen"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm4803213/","name":"June Laporte"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm4811901/","name":"Kurtis David Harder"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0311478/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0589466/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm4017355/","name":"Colin Minihan"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2151439/","name":"John Poliquin"}],"duration":"PT1H27M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Me, Myself & Irene
Ja, ja i Irene
programme.desc: Me, Myself & Irene: Directed by Bobby Farrelly, Peter Farrelly. With Jim Carrey, Renée Zellweger, Anthony Anderson, Mongo Brownlee. A nice-guy cop with Dissociative Identity Disorder must protect a woman on the run from a corrupt ex-boyfriend and his associates." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0183505/","name":"Me, Myself & Irene","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BODMwMDY2YzUtNGFiNS00NDA1LWI4YzMtYzVmM2RlZTk3NGVlXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTQxNzMzNDI@._V1_.jpg","description":"A nice-guy cop with Dissociative Identity Disorder must protect a woman on the run from a corrupt ex-boyfriend and his associates.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0183505/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"Quinoa1984"},"dateCreated":"2000-06-18","inLanguage":"English","name":"Black guys talking German","reviewBody":"This film is not only the funniest film of the year (so far), but one of the best of the year (so far). Jim Carrey's comedy antics (not seen this good in 3 years) makes a come back thanks to the Farrelly brothers (Dumb and Dumber, There's Something About Mary) who make their 2nd collaboration. Here, Carrey plays a gentle police officer who gets screwed in life so many times, he grows a new personality that is incredibly bad. \n\nCarrey plays 2 characters here- 1 (Charlie Baileygates) is a little funny, but the second (Hank) brings out one of Carrey's best performances yet. Renee Zelwegger is a good co-star for Carrey (coincidentally, Carrey dated Zelwegger off set just like how he dated Lauren Holly off set of Dumb and Dumber). The best scenes include the hilarious sex scenes, and Carrey's kids, who are straight A black guys who curse in every other sentence and yell German at each other. Split personality is at it's best here.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":231258,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.6},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Comedy"],"datePublished":"2000-06-23","keywords":"dissociative identity disorder,male objectification,erection visible through clothing,erect penis,erection","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Me, Myself And Irene","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2824798745","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMmMzNzJiYjMtYjkxNC00ZmM5LWI3NWQtNDRiMGI5MGU4NWExXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMmMzNzJiYjMtYjkxNC00ZmM5LWI3NWQtNDRiMGI5MGU4NWExXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Home Video Trailer from 20th Century Fox Home Entertainment"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000120/","name":"Jim Carrey"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000250/","name":"Renée Zellweger"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0026364/","name":"Anthony Anderson"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0125803/","name":"Bobby Farrelly"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0268380/","name":"Peter Farrelly"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0000756/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0030016/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0268380/","name":"Peter Farrelly"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0148808/","name":"Mike Cerrone"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0125803/","name":"Bobby Farrelly"}],"duration":"PT1H56M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Ja, ja i Irene
programme.desc: U ovoj izuzetnoj komediji različite karakterne crte policajca s Road Islanda bore se za naklonost lijepe žene. Braća Farrelly ("Svi su ludi za Mary") donose ovu urnebesnu komediju o dvama licima jednoga čovjeka. Upoznajte Charlieja Baileygatesa (Jim Carrey), veterana policije na Rhode Islandu koji ondje radi već 17 godina. Charlie je blag čovjek, marljiv, uvijek spreman pomoći, predan je i pažljiv otac svojoj trojici sinova. Nažalost, Charlie je dvostruka ličnost i, kada mu nestane lijekova... Upoznajte Hanka Baileygatesa (Jim Carrey), Charliejev agresivni alter ego. Hank psuje kao kočijaš, pije kao smuk, razbija glave i voli prljavi seks. Charlie i Hank nemaju ništa zajedničko... Osim Irene Waters (Renée Zellweger), prekrasne žene u koju su se obojica zaljubila. Sada Hank i Charlie moraju u boj, sa samima sobom, za Ireneine osjećaje.

programme.title: Standing Up for Sunny
Stand-up za Sunny
programme.desc: Standing Up for Sunny: Directed by Steven Vidler. With Radha Mitchell, RJ Mitte, Sam Reid, Matt Nable. programme.title: We're No Angels
Mi nismo anđeli
programme.desc:
We're No Angels: Directed by Neil Jordan. With Robert De Niro, Sean Penn, Demi Moore, Hoyt Axton. Two escaped cons only prayer to escape is to pass themselves off as priests and pass by the police blockade at the border into the safety of Canada." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0098625/","name":"We're No Angels","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMWQ3YWQ5NjMtNTVlZi00ZTk2LWFjZDctYjNiNzVhYjllMjFiXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMzk1NzcyOTA@._V1_.jpg","description":"Two escaped cons only prayer to escape is to pass themselves off as priests and pass by the police blockade at the border into the safety of Canada.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0098625/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"PredragReviews"},"dateCreated":"2017-04-06","inLanguage":"English","name":"Could be better.","reviewBody":""We're No Angels" is a movie made for those faces, and one of the pleasures of watching the film is to see them looking sidelong at each other as they try to figure a way out of the complicated mess they're in. The movie has a lot of other good stuff to look at (including dramatic period locations in a small Canadian town) and to listen to (dialogue by David Mamet), but I can think of no other recent movie in which so much of the pleasure lies in watching the expressions on the faces of the actors - especially when they're reacting, not talking. Mamet and Neil Jordan, who directed the movie, wisely remember the most important thing about any mistaken- identity comedy: The fact that someone's identity is mistaken is not always funny even the first time and rarely thereafter. Movies that depend on mistaken identities for their laughs are among the slowest, dreariest slogs through cinema.

Too bad that the film came out to be both simplistic and ordinary despite of the talent involved especially when it features De Niro and Penn,two of the best actors in Hollywood; and Jordan,one of the finest director of the industry.There were a lot of boring moments.Also,it just turned out to be somewhat corny and provides minimal laughter in a lot of scenes.Overall,it was definitely a misfire from the cast and the director involved as it does not live up to its potential.

Overall rating: 6 out of 10.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":6}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":22742,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.1},"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Comedy","Crime"],"datePublished":"1989-12-15","keywords":"lingerie slip,superstition,pig,cross,contraction in title","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"We're No Angels","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1578483225","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYWJiY2VjMDgtYWU5OC00NDllLTlmOTctM2Y0MzQ2NmRiNmM5XkEyXkFqcGdeQVRoaXJkUGFydHlJbmdlc3Rpb25Xb3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYWJiY2VjMDgtYWU5OC00NDllLTlmOTctM2Y0MzQ2NmRiNmM5XkEyXkFqcGdeQVRoaXJkUGFydHlJbmdlc3Rpb25Xb3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Official Trailer"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000134/","name":"Robert De Niro"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000576/","name":"Sean Penn"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000193/","name":"Demi Moore"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001403/","name":"Neil Jordan"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0023400/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0023400/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000519/","name":"David Mamet"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0532030/","name":"Ranald MacDougall"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0404062/","name":"Albert Husson"}],"duration":"PT1H46M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.review:
IMDb data; ttnr: 1091909, Title: Murdoch Mysteries, --- Description: Murdoch Mysteries: Created by Cal Coons, Alexandra Zarowny, Maureen Jennings, Bob Carney. With Yannick Bisson, Helene Joy, Thomas Craig, Jonny Harris. In the 1890s, William Murdoch uses radical forensic techniques for the time, including fingerprinting and trace evidence, to solve some of the city's most gruesome murders." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"TVSeries","url":"/title/tt1091909/","name":"Murdoch Mysteries","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjMwNjkzNDU4Ml5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwMDUxMTAyOA@@._V1_.jpg","description":"In the 1890s, William Murdoch uses radical forensic techniques for the time, including fingerprinting and trace evidence, to solve some of the city's most gruesome murders.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1091909/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"janice-lowing","dateCreated":"2012-12-28","inLanguage":"English","name":"Message from 'down under'","reviewBody":"There are so few shows that I thoroughly enjoy. Murchoch Mysteries is one of 4 particular shows that I watch regularly - and tape so that I do not miss them.

There are three main reasons that I like MM.

First, it is such a pleasure to watch something that does not have swearing, sex scenes, and gratuitous violence. Even though there are the odd (bordering on) romantic interludes the story line remains true to the theme of the title and they do not over-shadow the stories.

Second, I quite like viewing shows that depict times gone by and it is interesting to see how detectives'/police duties were (supposedly) undertaken in that time.

Third, the acting and story telling - as noted in a previous post - equals that of Midsummer Murders, Poirot (another favourite of mine), Judge John Deed (again, another favourite).

I like each character who has a distinct role and adds to the show as well as the enjoyment of watching the show. I do hope that there are quite a few new series planned.","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":10,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":12369,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":8.2,"contentRating":"TV-PG","genre":["Crime","Drama","Mystery"],"datePublished":"2008-01-01","keywords":"detective,police detective,morgue,police station,whodunit","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0084370/","name":"Yannick Bisson","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0431420/","name":"Helene Joy","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0186030/","name":"Thomas Craig"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0014501/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0382999/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0052272/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1779939/","name":"Cal Coons","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0953567/","name":"Alexandra Zarowny","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1485610/","name":"Maureen Jennings"],"trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Murdoch Mysteries: Season 8","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2131996697","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNmIwY2Y4ZGMtOTlmNi00ZDA4LTg5MGMtM2NjN2E0YTY3ZTgzXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNmIwY2Y4ZGMtOTlmNi00ZDA4LTg5MGMtM2NjN2E0YTY3ZTgzXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Trailer for Murdoch Mysteries: Season 8"</script><metacontent="

programme.desc:
All Creatures Great and Small: With Nicholas Ralph, Anna Madeley, Samuel West, Rachel Shenton. The numerous adventures of a friendly staff at a country veterinarian practice in 1930s to 1940s Yorkshire." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"TVSeries","url":"/title/tt10590066/","name":"All Creatures Great and Small","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZGU5NGRiMjAtMTJhYy00ZmNjLWJiNzktYTMwZTNhNzI1NTM5XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNDk3ODk4OQ@@._V1_.jpg","description":"The numerous adventures of a friendly staff at a country veterinarian practice in 1930s to 1940s Yorkshire.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt10590066/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"Sleepin_Dragon"},"dateCreated":"2020-09-11","inLanguage":"English","name":"I wasn't expecting that.","reviewBody":"I think it's fair to say that some, myself included wrote this off before it had even aired, Channel five hasn't really been known for original drama. I was definitely wrong, it's a great watch.

Channel Five has a real winner with his show, it is truly the tonic we need for 2020, it's uplifting, sentimental, it has a real feel good factor.

A winner in all areas, great stories, terrific acting, and a warmth that has been lacking in shows for some time.

How lovely to see Diana Rigg appear, ahead of her tragic death.

Chronicling the heartwarming and humorous adventures of a young country vet, the books introduced readers to his unconventional mentor and the cast of farmers and townsfolk who lived and worked in the Yorkshire Dales in the 1930s.

This new television adaptation will preserve the rich spirit, tone and values of Herriot’s iconic characters and stories and will bring to life his sharply observed, entertaining and incredibly funny tales of country life in the North of England for a modern audience, introducing a new generation to his life-affirming stories."}}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Murdoch Mysteries
Murdoch Mysteries
Murdoch Mysteries
programme.sub-title: S7 E1 S7 E1 Murdoch Ahoy
programme.desc:
Murdoch Mysteries: Created by Cal Coons, Alexandra Zarowny, Maureen Jennings, Bob Carney. With Yannick Bisson, Helene Joy, Thomas Craig, Jonny Harris. In the 1890s, William Murdoch uses radical forensic techniques for the time, including fingerprinting and trace evidence, to solve some of the city's most gruesome murders." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"TVSeries","url":"/title/tt1091909/","name":"Murdoch Mysteries","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjMwNjkzNDU4Ml5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwMDUxMTAyOA@@._V1_.jpg","description":"In the 1890s, William Murdoch uses radical forensic techniques for the time, including fingerprinting and trace evidence, to solve some of the city's most gruesome murders.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1091909/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"janice-lowing"},"dateCreated":"2012-12-28","inLanguage":"English","name":"Message from 'down under'","reviewBody":"There are so few shows that I thoroughly enjoy. Murchoch Mysteries is one of 4 particular shows that I watch regularly - and tape so that I do not miss them.

There are three main reasons that I like MM.

First, it is such a pleasure to watch something that does not have swearing, sex scenes, and gratuitous violence. Even though there are the odd (bordering on) romantic interludes the story line remains true to the theme of the title and they do not over-shadow the stories.

Second, I quite like viewing shows that depict times gone by and it is interesting to see how detectives'/police duties were (supposedly) undertaken in that time.

Third, the acting and story telling - as noted in a previous post - equals that of Midsummer Murders, Poirot (another favourite of mine), Judge John Deed (again, another favourite).

I like each character who has a distinct role and adds to the show as well as the enjoyment of watching the show. I do hope that there are quite a few new series planned.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":10}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":12369,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":8.2},"contentRating":"TV-PG","genre":["Crime","Drama","Mystery"],"datePublished":"2008-01-01","keywords":"detective,police detective,morgue,police station,whodunit","actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0084370/","name":"Yannick Bisson"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0431420/","name":"Helene Joy"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0186030/","name":"Thomas Craig"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0014501/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0382999/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0052272/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1779939/","name":"Cal Coons"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0953567/","name":"Alexandra Zarowny"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1485610/","name":"Maureen Jennings"}],"trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Murdoch Mysteries: Season 8","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2131996697","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNmIwY2Y4ZGMtOTlmNi00ZDA4LTg5MGMtM2NjN2E0YTY3ZTgzXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNmIwY2Y4ZGMtOTlmNi00ZDA4LTg5MGMtM2NjN2E0YTY3ZTgzXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Trailer for Murdoch Mysteries: Season 8"}}</script><metacontent="

Murchoch Mysteries is one of 4 particular shows that I watch regularly - and tape so that I do not miss them.

There are three main reasons that I like MM.

First, it is such a pleasure to watch something that does not have swearing, sex scenes, and gratuitous violence. Even though there are the odd (bordering on) romantic interludes the story line remains true to the theme of the title and they do not over-shadow the stories.

Second, I quite like viewing shows that depict times gone by and it is interesting to see how detectives'/police duties were (supposedly) undertaken in that time.

Third, the acting and story telling - as noted in a previous post - equals that of Midsummer Murders, Poirot (another favourite of mine), Judge John Deed (again, another favourite).

I like each character who has a distinct role and adds to the show as well as the enjoyment of watching the show. In the 1890s, William Murdoch uses radical forensic techniques for the time, including fingerprinting and trace evidence, to solve some of the city's most gruesome murders." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"TVSeries","url":"/title/tt1091909/","name":"Murdoch Mysteries","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjMwNjkzNDU4Ml5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwMDUxMTAyOA@@._V1_.jpg","description":"In the 1890s, William Murdoch uses radical forensic techniques for the time, including fingerprinting and trace evidence, to solve some of the city's most gruesome murders.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1091909/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"janice-lowing","dateCreated":"2012-12-28","inLanguage":"English","name":"Message from 'down under'","reviewBody":"There are so few shows that I thoroughly enjoy. Murchoch Mysteries is one of 4 particular shows that I watch regularly - and tape so that I do not miss them.

There are three main reasons that I like MM.

First, it is such a pleasure to watch something that does not have swearing, sex scenes, and gratuitous violence. Even though there are the odd (bordering on) romantic interludes the story line remains true to the theme of the title and they do not over-shadow the stories.

Second, I quite like viewing shows that depict times gone by and it is interesting to see how detectives'/police duties were (supposedly) undertaken in that time.

Third, the acting and story telling - as noted in a previous post - equals that of Midsummer Murders, Poirot (another favourite of mine), Judge John Deed (again, another favourite).

I like each character who has a distinct role and adds to the show as well as the enjoyment of watching the show. I do hope that there are quite a few new series planned.","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":10,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":12369,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":8.2,"contentRating":"TV-PG","genre":["Crime","Drama","Mystery"],"datePublished":"2008-01-01","keywords":"detective,police detective,morgue,police station,whodunit","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0084370/","name":"Yannick Bisson","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0431420/","name":"Helene Joy","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0186030/","name":"Thomas Craig"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0014501/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0382999/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0052272/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1779939/","name":"Cal Coons","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0953567/","name":"Alexandra Zarowny","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1485610/","name":"Maureen Jennings"],"trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Murdoch Mysteries: Season 8","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2131996697","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNmIwY2Y4ZGMtOTlmNi00ZDA4LTg5MGMtM2NjN2E0YTY3ZTgzXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNmIwY2Y4ZGMtOTlmNi00ZDA4LTg5MGMtM2NjN2E0YTY3ZTgzXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Trailer for Murdoch Mysteries: Season 8"</script><metacontent="

In the 1890s, William Murdoch uses radical forensic techniques for the time, including fingerprinting and trace evidence, to solve some of the city's most gruesome murders." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"TVSeries","url":"/title/tt1091909/","name":"Murdoch Mysteries","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjMwNjkzNDU4Ml5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwMDUxMTAyOA@@._V1_.jpg","description":"In the 1890s, William Murdoch uses radical forensic techniques for the time, including fingerprinting and trace evidence, to solve some of the city's most gruesome murders.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1091909/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"janice-lowing","dateCreated":"2012-12-28","inLanguage":"English","name":"Message from 'down under'","reviewBody":"There are so few shows that I thoroughly enjoy. Murchoch Mysteries is one of 4 particular shows that I watch regularly - and tape so that I do not miss them.

There are three main reasons that I like MM.

First, it is such a pleasure to watch something that does not have swearing, sex scenes, and gratuitous violence. Even though there are the odd (bordering on) romantic interludes the story line remains true to the theme of the title and they do not over-shadow the stories.

Second, I quite like viewing shows that depict times gone by and it is interesting to see how detectives'/police duties were (supposedly) undertaken in that time.

Third, the acting and story telling - as noted in a previous post - equals that of Midsummer Murders, Poirot (another favourite of mine), Judge John Deed (again, another favourite).

I like each character who has a distinct role and adds to the show as well as the enjoyment of watching the show. Murchoch Mysteries is one of 4 particular shows that I watch regularly - and tape so that I do not miss them.

There are three main reasons that I like MM.

First, it is such a pleasure to watch something that does not have swearing, sex scenes, and gratuitous violence. Even though there are the odd (bordering on) romantic interludes the story line remains true to the theme of the title and they do not over-shadow the stories.

Second, I quite like viewing shows that depict times gone by and it is interesting to see how detectives'/police duties were (supposedly) undertaken in that time.

Third, the acting and story telling - as noted in a previous post - equals that of Midsummer Murders, Poirot (another favourite of mine), Judge John Deed (again, another favourite).

I like each character who has a distinct role and adds to the show as well as the enjoyment of watching the show. There are three main reasons that I like MM.

First, it is such a pleasure to watch something that does not have swearing, sex scenes, and gratuitous violence. Even though there are the odd (bordering on) romantic interludes the story line remains true to the theme of the title and they do not over-shadow the stories.

Second, I quite like viewing shows that depict times gone by and it is interesting to see how detectives'/police duties were (supposedly) undertaken in that time.

Third, the acting and story telling - as noted in a previous post - equals that of Midsummer Murders, Poirot (another favourite of mine), Judge John Deed (again, another favourite).

I like each character who has a distinct role and adds to the show as well as the enjoyment of watching the show. I do hope that there are quite a few new series planned.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":10}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":12369,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":8.2},"contentRating":"TV-PG","genre":["Crime","Drama","Mystery"],"datePublished":"2008-01-01","keywords":"detective,police detective,morgue,police station,whodunit","actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0084370/","name":"Yannick Bisson"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0431420/","name":"Helene Joy"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0186030/","name":"Thomas Craig"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0014501/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0382999/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0052272/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1779939/","name":"Cal Coons"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0953567/","name":"Alexandra Zarowny"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1485610/","name":"Maureen Jennings"}],"trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Murdoch Mysteries: Season 8","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2131996697","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNmIwY2Y4ZGMtOTlmNi00ZDA4LTg5MGMtM2NjN2E0YTY3ZTgzXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNmIwY2Y4ZGMtOTlmNi00ZDA4LTg5MGMtM2NjN2E0YTY3ZTgzXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Trailer for Murdoch Mysteries: Season 8"}}</script><metacontent="

programme.review:
IMDb data; ttnr: 1091909, Title: Murdoch Mysteries, --- Description: Murdoch Mysteries: Created by Cal Coons, Alexandra Zarowny, Maureen Jennings, Bob Carney. With Yannick Bisson, Helene Joy, Thomas Craig, Jonny Harris. In the 1890s, William Murdoch uses radical forensic techniques for the time, including fingerprinting and trace evidence, to solve some of the city's most gruesome murders." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"TVSeries","url":"/title/tt1091909/","name":"Murdoch Mysteries","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjMwNjkzNDU4Ml5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwMDUxMTAyOA@@._V1_.jpg","description":"In the 1890s, William Murdoch uses radical forensic techniques for the time, including fingerprinting and trace evidence, to solve some of the city's most gruesome murders.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1091909/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"janice-lowing","dateCreated":"2012-12-28","inLanguage":"English","name":"Message from 'down under'","reviewBody":"There are so few shows that I thoroughly enjoy. Murchoch Mysteries is one of 4 particular shows that I watch regularly - and tape so that I do not miss them.

There are three main reasons that I like MM.

First, it is such a pleasure to watch something that does not have swearing, sex scenes, and gratuitous violence. Even though there are the odd (bordering on) romantic interludes the story line remains true to the theme of the title and they do not over-shadow the stories.

Second, I quite like viewing shows that depict times gone by and it is interesting to see how detectives'/police duties were (supposedly) undertaken in that time.

Third, the acting and story telling - as noted in a previous post - equals that of Midsummer Murders, Poirot (another favourite of mine), Judge John Deed (again, another favourite).

I like each character who has a distinct role and adds to the show as well as the enjoyment of watching the show. I do hope that there are quite a few new series planned.","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":10,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":12369,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":8.2,"contentRating":"TV-PG","genre":["Crime","Drama","Mystery"],"datePublished":"2008-01-01","keywords":"detective,police detective,morgue,police station,whodunit","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0084370/","name":"Yannick Bisson","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0431420/","name":"Helene Joy","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0186030/","name":"Thomas Craig"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0014501/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0382999/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0052272/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1779939/","name":"Cal Coons","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0953567/","name":"Alexandra Zarowny","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1485610/","name":"Maureen Jennings"],"trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Murdoch Mysteries: Season 8","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2131996697","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNmIwY2Y4ZGMtOTlmNi00ZDA4LTg5MGMtM2NjN2E0YTY3ZTgzXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNmIwY2Y4ZGMtOTlmNi00ZDA4LTg5MGMtM2NjN2E0YTY3ZTgzXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Trailer for Murdoch Mysteries: Season 8"</script><metacontent="

programme.review:
IMDb data; ttnr: 9179616, Title: Vienna Blood, --- Description: Vienna Blood: With Matthew Beard, Jürgen Maurer, Charlene McKenna, Conleth Hill. Max Liebermann, a student of Sigmund Freud, helps Detective Rheinhardt in the investigation of a series of disturbing murders around the grand cafes and opera houses of 1900s Vienna." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"TVSeries","url":"/title/tt9179616/","name":"Vienna Blood","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNTA3MjRiMDAtZTNlNy00ZGUyLTg5MmUtM2RmMDc4NzRlYzUxXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMjI4NzUwNzg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Max Liebermann, a student of Sigmund Freud, helps Detective Rheinhardt in the investigation of a series of disturbing murders around the grand cafes and opera houses of 1900s Vienna.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt9179616/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"irishsounds","dateCreated":"2019-12-04","inLanguage":"English","name":"10 Minutes in and I was hooked.","reviewBody":"Not for the unsophisticated block-buster fans or the action movie addicts. This superb, refreshingly different, historical who-done-it series takes a little bit of work to fully enjoy. It's not popcorn and candy cuisine, and it requires a degree of digesting.

It is quietly funny in places and very disturbing in others, the crumbling Empire and undertones of Nazism and not so much the gore are what I found to be the bits that left an aftertaste .

The main characters are very accessible. believable and quietly colourful. The casting, acting, directing, styling, cinematography, and for the most part the story lines were of a very high quality.

I am hooked, please sir can I have some more?

ADDENDUM: On reading some of the critical reviews, I felt I should add a further note to my very brief review in order to help place the series in a little sharper relief. One of the complaints I read was that the story lines were rather too simple, another complained that the series was slow moving.

The prime value for me in this excellent series is in enjoying the texture of the work. It is best not to view and to try to apprehend a grand master painting in the same way as one might set about enjoying a Mickey Mouse cartoon.

I loved the care taken with settings, camera angles, lighting, the colour balance etc. I loved the way both the visuals and story details were gradually unfolded and the characters allowed to evolve. My wish was rather to have some more time to explore the places, the times, and to get to know a little more of the intriguing characters.

Caveat emptor - If you want candy floss - look elsewhere.","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":9,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":3513,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.5,"contentRating":"TV-14","genre":["Crime","Drama","Mystery"],"datePublished":"2019-11-18","keywords":"fin de siecle,austria,vienna austria,police detective,vienna police department","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0063914/","name":"Matthew Beard","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0561029/","name":"Jürgen Maurer","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1800670/","name":"Charlene McKenna"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0104998/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0115148/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0078814/"],"trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Trailer - Season 1","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1751432729","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZmMxMWI2ZDUtYzdkNi00NDc3LWExNDEtNmFkNjVlOTA1NDNhXkEyXkFqcGdeQXN3aWZ0dw@@._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZmMxMWI2ZDUtYzdkNi00NDc3LWExNDEtNmFkNjVlOTA1NDNhXkEyXkFqcGdeQXN3aWZ0dw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Max Liebermann, a student of Sigmund Freud, helps Detective Rheinhardt in the investigation of a series of disturbing murders around the grand cafes and opera houses of 1900s Vienna."</script><metacontent="

Murchoch Mysteries is one of 4 particular shows that I watch regularly - and tape so that I do not miss them.

There are three main reasons that I like MM.

First, it is such a pleasure to watch something that does not have swearing, sex scenes, and gratuitous violence. Even though there are the odd (bordering on) romantic interludes the story line remains true to the theme of the title and they do not over-shadow the stories.

Second, I quite like viewing shows that depict times gone by and it is interesting to see how detectives'/police duties were (supposedly) undertaken in that time.

programme.title: Murdoch Mysteries

Murdoch Mysteries
programme.sub-title: S7 E1 S7 E1 Murdoch Ahoy
programme.desc:
Murdoch Mysteries: Created by Cal Coons, Alexandra Zarowny, Maureen Jennings, Bob Carney. With Yannick Bisson, Helene Joy, Thomas Craig, Jonny Harris. In the 1890s, William Murdoch uses radical forensic techniques for the time, including fingerprinting and trace evidence, to solve some of the city's most gruesome murders." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"TVSeries","url":"/title/tt1091909/","name":"Murdoch Mysteries","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjMwNjkzNDU4Ml5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwMDUxMTAyOA@@._V1_.jpg","description":"In the 1890s, William Murdoch uses radical forensic techniques for the time, including fingerprinting and trace evidence, to solve some of the city's most gruesome murders.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1091909/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"janice-lowing"},"dateCreated":"2012-12-28","inLanguage":"English","name":"Message from 'down under'","reviewBody":"There are so few shows that I thoroughly enjoy. Murchoch Mysteries is one of 4 particular shows that I watch regularly - and tape so that I do not miss them.

There are three main reasons that I like MM.

First, it is such a pleasure to watch something that does not have swearing, sex scenes, and gratuitous violence. Even though there are the odd (bordering on) romantic interludes the story line remains true to the theme of the title and they do not over-shadow the stories.

Second, I quite like viewing shows that depict times gone by and it is interesting to see how detectives'/police duties were (supposedly) undertaken in that time.

Third, the acting and story telling - as noted in a previous post - equals that of Midsummer Murders, Poirot (another favourite of mine), Judge John Deed (again, another favourite).

I like each character who has a distinct role and adds to the show as well as the enjoyment of watching the show. I do hope that there are quite a few new series planned.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":10}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":12369,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":8.2},"contentRating":"TV-PG","genre":["Crime","Drama","Mystery"],"datePublished":"2008-01-01","keywords":"detective,police detective,morgue,police station,whodunit","actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0084370/","name":"Yannick Bisson"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0431420/","name":"Helene Joy"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0186030/","name":"Thomas Craig"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0014501/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0382999/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0052272/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1779939/","name":"Cal Coons"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0953567/","name":"Alexandra Zarowny"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1485610/","name":"Maureen Jennings"}],"trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Murdoch Mysteries: Season 8","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2131996697","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNmIwY2Y4ZGMtOTlmNi00ZDA4LTg5MGMtM2NjN2E0YTY3ZTgzXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNmIwY2Y4ZGMtOTlmNi00ZDA4LTg5MGMtM2NjN2E0YTY3ZTgzXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Trailer for Murdoch Mysteries: Season 8"}}</script><metacontent="

There are three main reasons that I like MM.

First, it is such a pleasure to watch something that does not have swearing, sex scenes, and gratuitous violence. Even though there are the odd (bordering on) romantic interludes the story line remains true to the theme of the title and they do not over-shadow the stories.

Second, I quite like viewing shows that depict times gone by and it is interesting to see how detectives'/police duties were (supposedly) undertaken in that time.

Third, the acting and story telling - as noted in a previous post - equals that of Midsummer Murders, Poirot (another favourite of mine), Judge John Deed (again, another favourite).

programme.title: Murdoch Mysteries
Murdoch Mysteries
Murdoch Mysteries
programme.sub-title: S7 E3 S7 E3 The Filmed Adventures Of Detective William Murdoch
programme.desc:
Murdoch Mysteries: Created by Cal Coons, Alexandra Zarowny, Maureen Jennings, Bob Carney. With Yannick Bisson, Helene Joy, Thomas Craig, Jonny Harris. In the 1890s, William Murdoch uses radical forensic techniques for the time, including fingerprinting and trace evidence, to solve some of the city's most gruesome murders." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"TVSeries","url":"/title/tt1091909/","name":"Murdoch Mysteries","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjMwNjkzNDU4Ml5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwMDUxMTAyOA@@._V1_.jpg","description":"In the 1890s, William Murdoch uses radical forensic techniques for the time, including fingerprinting and trace evidence, to solve some of the city's most gruesome murders.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1091909/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"janice-lowing"},"dateCreated":"2012-12-28","inLanguage":"English","name":"Message from 'down under'","reviewBody":"There are so few shows that I thoroughly enjoy. Murchoch Mysteries is one of 4 particular shows that I watch regularly - and tape so that I do not miss them.

There are three main reasons that I like MM.

First, it is such a pleasure to watch something that does not have swearing, sex scenes, and gratuitous violence. Even though there are the odd (bordering on) romantic interludes the story line remains true to the theme of the title and they do not over-shadow the stories.

Second, I quite like viewing shows that depict times gone by and it is interesting to see how detectives'/police duties were (supposedly) undertaken in that time.

Third, the acting and story telling - as noted in a previous post - equals that of Midsummer Murders, Poirot (another favourite of mine), Judge John Deed (again, another favourite).

I like each character who has a distinct role and adds to the show as well as the enjoyment of watching the show. programme.category: Crime, Drama, Mystery, Crime, Drama, Mystery
programme.review:
IMDb data; ttnr: 1091909, Title: Murdoch Mysteries, --- Description: Murdoch Mysteries: Created by Cal Coons, Alexandra Zarowny, Maureen Jennings, Bob Carney. With Yannick Bisson, Helene Joy, Thomas Craig, Jonny Harris. In the 1890s, William Murdoch uses radical forensic techniques for the time, including fingerprinting and trace evidence, to solve some of the city's most gruesome murders." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"TVSeries","url":"/title/tt1091909/","name":"Murdoch Mysteries","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjMwNjkzNDU4Ml5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwMDUxMTAyOA@@._V1_.jpg","description":"In the 1890s, William Murdoch uses radical forensic techniques for the time, including fingerprinting and trace evidence, to solve some of the city's most gruesome murders.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1091909/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"janice-lowing","dateCreated":"2012-12-28","inLanguage":"English","name":"Message from 'down under'","reviewBody":"There are so few shows that I thoroughly enjoy. Murchoch Mysteries is one of 4 particular shows that I watch regularly - and tape so that I do not miss them.

There are three main reasons that I like MM.

First, it is such a pleasure to watch something that does not have swearing, sex scenes, and gratuitous violence. Even though there are the odd (bordering on) romantic interludes the story line remains true to the theme of the title and they do not over-shadow the stories.

Second, I quite like viewing shows that depict times gone by and it is interesting to see how detectives'/police duties were (supposedly) undertaken in that time.

Third, the acting and story telling - as noted in a previous post - equals that of Midsummer Murders, Poirot (another favourite of mine), Judge John Deed (again, another favourite).

I like each character who has a distinct role and adds to the show as well as the enjoyment of watching the show. I do hope that there are quite a few new series planned.","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":10,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":12369,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":8.2,"contentRating":"TV-PG","genre":["Crime","Drama","Mystery"],"datePublished":"2008-01-01","keywords":"detective,police detective,morgue,police station,whodunit","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0084370/","name":"Yannick Bisson","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0431420/","name":"Helene Joy","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0186030/","name":"Thomas Craig"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0014501/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0382999/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0052272/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1779939/","name":"Cal Coons","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0953567/","name":"Alexandra Zarowny","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1485610/","name":"Maureen Jennings"],"trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Murdoch Mysteries: Season 8","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2131996697","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNmIwY2Y4ZGMtOTlmNi00ZDA4LTg5MGMtM2NjN2E0YTY3ZTgzXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNmIwY2Y4ZGMtOTlmNi00ZDA4LTg5MGMtM2NjN2E0YTY3ZTgzXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Trailer for Murdoch Mysteries: Season 8"</script><metacontent="

IMDb data; ttnr: 1091909, Title: Murdoch Mysteries, --- Description: Murdoch Mysteries: Created by Cal Coons, Alexandra Zarowny, Maureen Jennings, Bob Carney. In the 1890s, William Murdoch uses radical forensic techniques for the time, including fingerprinting and trace evidence, to solve some of the city's most gruesome murders." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"TVSeries","url":"/title/tt1091909/","name":"Murdoch Mysteries","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjMwNjkzNDU4Ml5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwMDUxMTAyOA@@._V1_.jpg","description":"In the 1890s, William Murdoch uses radical forensic techniques for the time, including fingerprinting and trace evidence, to solve some of the city's most gruesome murders.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1091909/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"janice-lowing","dateCreated":"2012-12-28","inLanguage":"English","name":"Message from 'down under'","reviewBody":"There are so few shows that I thoroughly enjoy. Murchoch Mysteries is one of 4 particular shows that I watch regularly - and tape so that I do not miss them.

There are three main reasons that I like MM.

First, it is such a pleasure to watch something that does not have swearing, sex scenes, and gratuitous violence. Even though there are the odd (bordering on) romantic interludes the story line remains true to the theme of the title and they do not over-shadow the stories.

Second, I quite like viewing shows that depict times gone by and it is interesting to see how detectives'/police duties were (supposedly) undertaken in that time.

Third, the acting and story telling - as noted in a previous post - equals that of Midsummer Murders, Poirot (another favourite of mine), Judge John Deed (again, another favourite).

I like each character who has a distinct role and adds to the show as well as the enjoyment of watching the show. I do hope that there are quite a few new series planned.","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":10,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":12369,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":8.2,"contentRating":"TV-PG","genre":["Crime","Drama","Mystery"],"datePublished":"2008-01-01","keywords":"detective,police detective,morgue,police station,whodunit","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0084370/","name":"Yannick Bisson","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0431420/","name":"Helene Joy","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0186030/","name":"Thomas Craig"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0014501/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0382999/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0052272/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1779939/","name":"Cal Coons","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0953567/","name":"Alexandra Zarowny","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1485610/","name":"Maureen Jennings"],"trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Murdoch Mysteries: Season 8","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2131996697","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNmIwY2Y4ZGMtOTlmNi00ZDA4LTg5MGMtM2NjN2E0YTY3ZTgzXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNmIwY2Y4ZGMtOTlmNi00ZDA4LTg5MGMtM2NjN2E0YTY3ZTgzXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Trailer for Murdoch Mysteries: Season 8"</script><metacontent="

programme.review: --- Actors: Yannick Bisson (role=Detective William Murdoch), Helene Joy (role=Dr. Julia Ogden), Thomas Craig (role=Inspector Thomas Brackenreid), Jonny Harris (role=Constable George Crabtree), Lachlan Murdoch (role=Constable Henry Higgins), Georgina Reilly (role=Dr. Emily Grace), Daniel Maslany (role=Detective Llewellyn Watts), Shanice Banton (role=Violet Hart), Arwen Humphreys (role=Margaret Brackenreid), Kristian Bruun (role=Constable Slugger Jackson), Mouna Traoré (role=Rebecca James), Bea Santos (role=Louise Cherry)

IMDb data; ttnr: 1091909, Title: Murdoch Mysteries, --- Description: Murdoch Mysteries: Created by Cal Coons, Alexandra Zarowny, Maureen Jennings, Bob Carney. With Yannick Bisson, Helene Joy, Thomas Craig, Jonny Harris. In the 1890s, William Murdoch uses radical forensic techniques for the time, including fingerprinting and trace evidence, to solve some of the city's most gruesome murders." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"TVSeries","url":"/title/tt1091909/","name":"Murdoch Mysteries","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjMwNjkzNDU4Ml5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwMDUxMTAyOA@@._V1_.jpg","description":"In the 1890s, William Murdoch uses radical forensic techniques for the time, including fingerprinting and trace evidence, to solve some of the city's most gruesome murders.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1091909/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"janice-lowing","dateCreated":"2012-12-28","inLanguage":"English","name":"Message from 'down under'","reviewBody":"There are so few shows that I thoroughly enjoy. Murchoch Mysteries is one of 4 particular shows that I watch regularly - and tape so that I do not miss them.

There are three main reasons that I like MM.

First, it is such a pleasure to watch something that does not have swearing, sex scenes, and gratuitous violence. Even though there are the odd (bordering on) romantic interludes the story line remains true to the theme of the title and they do not over-shadow the stories.

Second, I quite like viewing shows that depict times gone by and it is interesting to see how detectives'/police duties were (supposedly) undertaken in that time.

Third, the acting and story telling - as noted in a previous post - equals that of Midsummer Murders, Poirot (another favourite of mine), Judge John Deed (again, another favourite).

I like each character who has a distinct role and adds to the show as well as the enjoyment of watching the show. I do hope that there are quite a few new series planned.","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":10,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":12369,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":8.2,"contentRating":"TV-PG","genre":["Crime","Drama","Mystery"],"datePublished":"2008-01-01","keywords":"detective,police detective,morgue,police station,whodunit","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0084370/","name":"Yannick Bisson","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0431420/","name":"Helene Joy","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0186030/","name":"Thomas Craig"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0014501/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0382999/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0052272/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1779939/","name":"Cal Coons","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0953567/","name":"Alexandra Zarowny","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1485610/","name":"Maureen Jennings"],"trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Murdoch Mysteries: Season 8","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2131996697","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNmIwY2Y4ZGMtOTlmNi00ZDA4LTg5MGMtM2NjN2E0YTY3ZTgzXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNmIwY2Y4ZGMtOTlmNi00ZDA4LTg5MGMtM2NjN2E0YTY3ZTgzXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Trailer for Murdoch Mysteries: Season 8"</script><metacontent="

With Yannick Bisson, Helene Joy, Thomas Craig, Jonny Harris. In the 1890s, William Murdoch uses radical forensic techniques for the time, including fingerprinting and trace evidence, to solve some of the city's most gruesome murders." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"TVSeries","url":"/title/tt1091909/","name":"Murdoch Mysteries","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjMwNjkzNDU4Ml5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwMDUxMTAyOA@@._V1_.jpg","description":"In the 1890s, William Murdoch uses radical forensic techniques for the time, including fingerprinting and trace evidence, to solve some of the city's most gruesome murders.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1091909/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"janice-lowing","dateCreated":"2012-12-28","inLanguage":"English","name":"Message from 'down under'","reviewBody":"There are so few shows that I thoroughly enjoy. Murchoch Mysteries is one of 4 particular shows that I watch regularly - and tape so that I do not miss them.

There are three main reasons that I like MM.

First, it is such a pleasure to watch something that does not have swearing, sex scenes, and gratuitous violence. Even though there are the odd (bordering on) romantic interludes the story line remains true to the theme of the title and they do not over-shadow the stories.

Second, I quite like viewing shows that depict times gone by and it is interesting to see how detectives'/police duties were (supposedly) undertaken in that time.

Third, the acting and story telling - as noted in a previous post - equals that of Midsummer Murders, Poirot (another favourite of mine), Judge John Deed (again, another favourite).

I like each character who has a distinct role and adds to the show as well as the enjoyment of watching the show. I do hope that there are quite a few new series planned.","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":10,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":12369,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":8.2,"contentRating":"TV-PG","genre":["Crime","Drama","Mystery"],"datePublished":"2008-01-01","keywords":"detective,police detective,morgue,police station,whodunit","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0084370/","name":"Yannick Bisson","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0431420/","name":"Helene Joy","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0186030/","name":"Thomas Craig"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0014501/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0382999/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0052272/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1779939/","name":"Cal Coons","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0953567/","name":"Alexandra Zarowny","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1485610/","name":"Maureen Jennings"],"trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Murdoch Mysteries: Season 8","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2131996697","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNmIwY2Y4ZGMtOTlmNi00ZDA4LTg5MGMtM2NjN2E0YTY3ZTgzXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNmIwY2Y4ZGMtOTlmNi00ZDA4LTg5MGMtM2NjN2E0YTY3ZTgzXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Trailer for Murdoch Mysteries: Season 8"</script><metacontent="

With Yannick Bisson, Helene Joy, Thomas Craig, Jonny Harris. In the 1890s, William Murdoch uses radical forensic techniques for the time, including fingerprinting and trace evidence, to solve some of the city's most gruesome murders." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"TVSeries","url":"/title/tt1091909/","name":"Murdoch Mysteries","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjMwNjkzNDU4Ml5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwMDUxMTAyOA@@._V1_.jpg","description":"In the 1890s, William Murdoch uses radical forensic techniques for the time, including fingerprinting and trace evidence, to solve some of the city's most gruesome murders.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1091909/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"janice-lowing","dateCreated":"2012-12-28","inLanguage":"English","name":"Message from 'down under'","reviewBody":"There are so few shows that I thoroughly enjoy. Murchoch Mysteries is one of 4 particular shows that I watch regularly - and tape so that I do not miss them.

There are three main reasons that I like MM.

First, it is such a pleasure to watch something that does not have swearing, sex scenes, and gratuitous violence. Even though there are the odd (bordering on) romantic interludes the story line remains true to the theme of the title and they do not over-shadow the stories.

Second, I quite like viewing shows that depict times gone by and it is interesting to see how detectives'/police duties were (supposedly) undertaken in that time.

Third, the acting and story telling - as noted in a previous post - equals that of Midsummer Murders, Poirot (another favourite of mine), Judge John Deed (again, another favourite).

I like each character who has a distinct role and adds to the show as well as the enjoyment of watching the show. I do hope that there are quite a few new series planned.","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":10,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":12369,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":8.2,"contentRating":"TV-PG","genre":["Crime","Drama","Mystery"],"datePublished":"2008-01-01","keywords":"detective,police detective,morgue,police station,whodunit","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0084370/","name":"Yannick Bisson","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0431420/","name":"Helene Joy","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0186030/","name":"Thomas Craig"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0014501/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0382999/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0052272/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1779939/","name":"Cal Coons","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0953567/","name":"Alexandra Zarowny","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1485610/","name":"Maureen Jennings"],"trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Murdoch Mysteries: Season 8","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2131996697","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNmIwY2Y4ZGMtOTlmNi00ZDA4LTg5MGMtM2NjN2E0YTY3ZTgzXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNmIwY2Y4ZGMtOTlmNi00ZDA4LTg5MGMtM2NjN2E0YTY3ZTgzXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Trailer for Murdoch Mysteries: Season 8"</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Marple
Agatha Christie's Marple
Agatha Christie's Marple
programme.sub-title: S1 E4 S1 E4 A Murder is Announced
programme.desc: Agatha Christie's Marple: With Geraldine McEwan, Julia McKenzie, Stephen Churchett, Isabella Parriss. An elderly spinster living in the village of St. Mary Mead, helps her friends and relatives solve mysterious murders." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"TVSeries","url":"/title/tt1734537/","name":"Agatha Christie's Marple","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMDdhMzBlOWEtOWZiYi00NzRmLTgxMTktZDBkOWY0NmI5ODc3XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMjExMjk0ODk@._V1_.jpg","description":"An elderly spinster living in the village of St. Mary Mead, helps her friends and relatives solve mysterious murders.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1734537/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"pirslya"},"dateCreated":"2014-06-16","inLanguage":"English","name":"So enjoyable to watch!!","reviewBody":"well, I haven't really read any books of Agatha Christie (except The Death on the Nile) and as a viewer, I found this series so enjoyable! and my favorite Miss Marple is Geraldine McEwan because i thought she amused me kind of sad she didn't continue but it's understandable! when the plot was sometimes didn't really work on me, I thought it's something that made me want to watch it more and ended up wanting to watch more. It's one of the first British TV series that I watched, and it's something that I wouldn't regret. programme.review: IMDb data; ttnr: 6881870, Title: Frankie Drake Mysteries, --- Description: Frankie Drake Mysteries: Created by Carol Hay, Michelle Ricci, Cal Coons.
